result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CASH BAIL PREVIOUSLY POSTED OF $400 TO BE APPLIED TO THIS BOND. 
Cash bond is set in the amount of $650 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with CMF. 
- Defendant shall not be on Trailsway in Madison or the 100 block of Owen Rd in Monona. 
Trial Judge - Br 7

04:19 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Stanley V. Woodard.  William Leroy Brown appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. State moved to amend Complaint to remove Attempt enhancer and language. Objection by defense. COURT ORALLY AMENDED COMPLAINT AND DISMISSED ATTEMPT ENHANCER.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 08:00 am.
